dt: {bc}having the hair cut close to the skin
{bc}cut from a larger portion into thin slivers or slices

dt.t: Instead of cheese shaving, try {wi}shaved{/wi} fennel, radish or cucumber. An Asian-style presentation could include soy sauce, sesame oil, grated ginger and {wi}shaved{/wi} daikon radish.

shortdef: having the hair cut close to the skin
cut from a larger portion into thin slivers or slices

dt: {bc}to cut off in thin layers or shreds {bc}{sx|slice||}
{bc}to sever the hair from (the head or another part of the body) close to the roots
{bc}to cut off (hair or beard) close to the skin
{bc}to discount (a note) at an exorbitant rate
{bc}to conspire to score fewer (points) than one is capable of (as to affect gambling outcomes)
{bc}to come close to or touch lightly in passing
{bc}to cut off hair or beard close to the skin

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}scafan{/it}; akin to Lithuanian {it}skobti{/it} to pluck, Latin {it}scabere{/it} to scratch, and perhaps to Greek {it}koptein{/it} to cut {ma}{mat|capon|}{/ma}
shortdef: to remove a thin layer from
to cut off in thin layers or shreds : slice
